page.title: 01The Skares (Teeth)
page.content: The small coastal hamlet of Whinnyfold lies to the south of Cruden Bay. The population of around 50 are mainly commuters into Aberdeen. To the north, Cruden bay is the nearest supportive small town. Here the coastal rocks abruptly change from Gneiss to granite and afford an excellent field of study for geologists. The Skares a gorup of prominent rocks approx 1/2 mile into the sea are the main feature of this area. The whole sea coasts exhibits a magnificent natural section of the rocks forming lofty and often highly picturesque precipices. Whinnyfold is serviced by one single track metalld road
